addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. howe matters have passed
till
M
r
Carons
comming, by my last to yo
r
H.
sent by
M
r
Gilpins
man, and by others before to
my
L. Treasuro
r
, I signfied at large. Since
his comming, howe he hath proceeded, I leave to
be related by himself: in whome there is no
want of diligence and circumspection to per-
fourme his charge to
e uttermost. I have
returned answear at this present, to my L.Treasurers Letters sent unto me by this bearer,to whiche I make bolde as heeretofore, to referreyo
r
H. for
e occurrence of this place. Yo
r
H.
letter unto me in favo
r
of
Cap
t
Morgan
for
e
serjant majorshippe of
Berghen,
being written
e 3 of this moneth, came not to my handes till
e 20 day, after
e place was bestowed by the
Councell of state
uppon one
Lovell,
who receaved
his c
o
mission in
at behalf, and was sworen almost
fortnight before. otherwise, if it had bin integrum
unto me, I would have done my uttermost ende-
vo
r
, to have accomplished in that as alwaies in
all thinges yo
r
H. desire.
And so I take
my humble leave. From
e Hage. 22 A
p
89
Yo
r
H most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
M
r
Caron having shutte up
his letters, requesteth me to
signifie in his behalf to yo
r
H.
that understanding of
e states
assembled in
Frise,
he purposeth
to depart thitherwardes to morowe
or
e next day, and to
take
e
Count Neuwenar
in his way.
